== Key Details ==

* Date - September 27, 2007
* Team Contact - ChrisRohde, EldoVarghese, <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntu.com/pak33m|Jimmy Harris]]</nowiki>
* Membership - 98 as of September 20th, 2007
* Forum - http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=225
* Launchpad - http://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-us-florida
* Mailing List - Ubuntu-us-fl on lists.ubuntu.com (Archives <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-us-fl|here]]</nowiki>)
* IRC - #ubuntu-florida on Freenode

== Roadmap ==
* '''Local Advocacy:'''
** Develop Florida-specific backgrounds for a <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntu.com/FloridaTeam/Minutes/Apr01|possible florida Ubuntu LiveCD]]</nowiki>
** Attend more expos and shows to hand out even more CDs, flyers, posters, and other swag while demonstrating Ubuntu and Variants to the crowd
** Working with AlabamaTeam and GeorgiaTeam on possible collaboration for multi-state Linux Fest (long term goal)
* '''Charitable Advocacy and Exposure:'''
** Start a local <nowiki>[[http://www.freegeek.org|freegeek chapter]]</nowiki> (discussion <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntu.com/FloridaTeam/Minutes/Apr01|here]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=387124|here]]</nowiki>)
** If freegeek is not feasible, possible work with <nowiki>[[http://www.computers4kids.net/|Computers 4 Kids]]</nowiki> or other such distribution program
** Need channel to direct and support team's existing efforts of distributing computers with Xubuntu
* '''LoCo Support:'''
** Become more active within Ubuntu US community as <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntu.com/FloridaTeam/Minutes/Apr01|mentors]]</nowiki> to new and struggling teams 
* '''Development'''
** Provide assistance with programming and packaging on and for Ubuntu 

== Experience ==
* '''Communication:'''
** We are maintaining multiple lines of communication, including <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntu.com/FloridaTeam|a Wiki]]</nowiki>, a <nowiki>[[http://florida.ubuntuforums.org|sub-forum]]</nowiki>, an IRC Channel (#ubuntu-florida) and <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-us-fl|a mailing list]]</nowiki>.
* '''Advocacy'''
** Manned a booth at the <nowiki>[[http://www.eocc.org/component/option,com_gigcal/task,details/day,1/|East Orlando Chamber of Commerce Business Expo]]</nowiki>
** Handed out CDs, pamphlets, posters, stickers, and t-shirts
** Met and spoke to numerous small businesses about the benefits of switching to Ubuntu
** Some members attended Software Freedom Day at the University of Florida in Gainesville, FL
** Around 10 members attended Florida's first <nowiki>[[http://www.barcamp.org|BarCamp]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.barcamporlando.org|BarCamp Orlando]]</nowiki> September 23rd
** Gave talks relating to Ubuntu, LoCo Teams
** Held installfest for interested users
* '''Sub-Team Delegation:'''
** We have organized several sub-teams for issues such as <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/FloridaTeam/MarketingIdeas|Marketing]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubuntu.com/FloridaTeam/NewMembers|New Member Orientation and Support]]</nowiki>.
* '''Distribution and Charity:'''
** Distributed refurbished computers with Ubuntu on them, in the absence of a Florida Chapter of Freegeek.org (discussed <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/FloridaTeam/Minutes/Apr01Formal|here]]</nowiki>)
* '''Development'''
** Offering programming advice to other team members on #ubuntu-florida
** Made a package for coverage.py (named python-coverage, worked with MOTU team, package sponsored for Gutsy on June 15, 2007 by dholbach)
** Teaching people how to use Bazaar
** Minor patches for bazaar (lstat fixes and tests in bzrlib, option aliases for --missing command)
** Working on adding support for Bazaar to <nowiki>[[http://review-board.org|review board]]</nowiki>.
** participating in #mysql-dev discussions
** participating on #launchpad, helping people learn how to use Launchpad
